title: How to Make White Chocolate Pumpkin Pretzels

steps.headline: Cover a baking tray with parchment leaving the edges hanging.
Melt the white chocolate chips.
steps.description: In a microwave-safe bowl, pour the chocolate chips into the bowl and place it in the microwave. Microwave for one minute, stirring gently with a spoon, until the white chocolate is fully melted and smooth.

steps.headline: Add the orange food coloring.
steps.description: Add ten drops of orange food coloring into the melted white chocolate. Stir with a spoon until the color appears clearly and is vibrant.

steps.headline: Dip the pretzels into the orange white chocolate using cooking tongs or tweezers.
steps.description: Place them on the baking tray.

steps.headline: Add the 'stems' by placing a green M&M near the top of the pretzel.
Have the pretzels sit until the chocolate hardens, usually taking about ten minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Remove the pretzels carefully from the baking tray using a spatula. Place them in a large serving bowl. Enjoy!

text: Cover a baking tray with parchment leaving the edges hanging.  Melt the white chocolate chips. In a microwave-safe bowl, pour the chocolate chips into the bowl and place it in the microwave. Microwave for one minute, stirring gently with a spoon, until the white chocolate is fully melted and smooth. Add the orange food coloring. Add ten drops of orange food coloring into the melted white chocolate. Stir with a spoon until the color appears clearly and is vibrant. Dip the pretzels into the orange white chocolate using cooking tongs or tweezers. Place them on the baking tray. Add the 'stems' by placing a green M&M near the top of the pretzel.  Have the pretzels sit until the chocolate hardens, usually taking about ten minutes.  Serve. Remove the pretzels carefully from the baking tray using a spatula. Place them in a large serving bowl. Enjoy!
